descriptions.content:
The secondary verbs ལོང་ and རན་ take the same place as modal verbs. The main verb, which precedes them, should be in the present-future and not the past. In the present, the verb ལོང་ is followed by the egophoric auxiliary ཡོད་ or the constative auxiliary འདུག་. In the past, the verb ལོང་ is followed by the auxiliary བྱུང་ (egophoric) or བྱུང་སོང་ (constative); in the future it is followed by the auxiliary ཡོང་.

The verb རན་ is generally used in the past with the past auxiliaries: རན་སོང་, རན་བཞག་, and རན་པ་རེད་. It is also sometimes in the present: རན་གྱི་འདུག་.

  • ང་ལ་ཇ་འཐུང་ལོང་མེད། “I haven’t got time to drink tea.”
  • ཡི་གེ་འདི་ཀློག་ལོང་ཡོད་པས། “Have you got time to read this letter?”
  • ཇ་སྐོལ་ལོང་ད་ཨ་ཡོང་། “You probably haven’t got time to make tea.”
  • ང་ལས་ཁུངས་ལ་འགྲོ་རན་སོང་། “It’s time I went to the office.”
